content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully built on the map. The agent made several attempts to deploy a Lab at Position(0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to research, but these placements failed.  
• While the agent did retrieve existing smelting facilities—a furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) used for converting iron ore (with coal) into iron plates and a copper furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0) used for processing copper ore into copper plates—these were not constructed by the agent and remain part of the pre‐existing environment.

ERROR TIPS
• Correct API Usage for Entity Retrieval  
 – When using get_entities, ensure that the call matches its expected signature. Errors arose both from using an unexpected keyword argument (‘radius’) and from providing extra positional arguments. Verify the API documentation and use only the supported parameters.

• Handling Null Returns  
 – When filtering retrieved entities (for example, lab instances), check whether the result is None before iterating. Using a fallback (such as an empty list) helps avoid TypeErrors from attempting to iterate over a NoneType.

• Validating Placement Conditions  
 – Before attempting to place a structure, confirm that the required inventory item (in this case, a Lab) is present. Also ensure that the target position is valid and unoccupied to avoid placement errors.

• Ensuring Crafting Prerequisites  
 – The lab crafting errors indicate missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables). Prior to crafting complex items, verify that all necessary intermediate components are either available or can be produced via the appropriate production chain (e.g., furnaces or assembling machines).
